name: Bearing angle
description: The bearing angle is the angle between the tail vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0� indicates that larvae are oriented directly towards the odour, 180� that they are oriented directly away from the odour. Positive values indicate the odour is to the right, negative values that the odour is to the left. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Heading angle
description: The heading angle is the angle between the head vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0� indicates that the larva's head is oriented directly towards the odour, 180� that it are oriented directly away from the odour. Positive values indicate the odour is to the right, negative values that thei odour is to the left. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Bending angle
description: The angle between the larva's tail vector, and a vector from the middle of the larva to its head. Positive values indicate the larva bending to the left, negative values bending to the right. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Absolute bearing angle
description: The bearing angle is the angle between the tail vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0� indicates that larvae are oriented directly towards the odour, 180� that they are oriented directly away from the odour. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Absolute heading angle
description: The heading angle is the angle between the head vector and the vector from the animal towards the odour. 0� indicates that the larva's head is oriented directly towards the odour, 180� that it are oriented directly away from the odour. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Absolute bending angle
description: The angle between the larva's tail vector, and a vector from the middle of the larva to its head. The absolute bending angle indicates how much the larva is bent, independent from direction. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: HV angular speed
description: The angular speed of the head vector (HV). Positive values indicate movement of the head to the right, negative values to the left. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: TV angular speed
description: The angular speed of the tail vector (TV). Positive values indicate movement to the right, negative values to the left. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Absolute HV angular speed
description: The angular speed of the tail vector (TV). Positive values indicate movement to the right, negative values to the left. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Absolute TV angular speed
description: The angular speed of the tail vector (TV). Positive values indicate movement to the right, negative values to the left. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Head forward velocity
description: The speed of the larva's head point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Tail forward velocity
description: The speed of the larva's tail point in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Midpoint speed
description: The speed of the larva's midpoint, independent of direction. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Distance traveled
description: The distance a larva has travelled so far. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Distance to odour source
description: The distance of of a larva to the odour source. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Head forward velocity (body length)
description: The velocity of the larva's head point (measured in body lengths per second) in forward direction, that is, in direction of the head vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Tail forward velocity (body length)
description: The velocity of the larva's tail point (measured in body lengths per second) in forward direction, that is, in direction of the tail vector. Any lateral speed component is ignored. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Midpoint speed (body length)
description: The speed of the larva's midpoint (measured in body lengths per second), independent of direction. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Distance traveled (body length)
description: The distance a larva has travelled so far. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: IS angle
description: The inter-step (IS) angle indicates how much the orientation of the animal changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is defined as the angle between a larva's head vector at one step minus the head vector at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the Tail velocity during runs. Positive values indicate that the larva changes its orientation to the left, negative values that it changes its orientation to the right. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Absolute IS angle
description: The inter-step (IS) angle indicates how much the orientation of the animal changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is defined as the angle between a larva's head vector at one step minus the head vector at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the Tail velocity during runs. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: IS reorientation
description: The inter-step (IS) reorientation indicates how much the orientation of the animal with respect to the odour changes within one cycle of peristaltic forward movement. It is calculated as the larva's heading angle at one step minus the heading angle at the previous step. A step is defined as the local maximum of the Tail velocity during runs. Positive values indicate that the larva changes its orientation towards the odour, negative values that it changes its orientation away from the odour. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: IS interval
description: The inter-step (IS) interval measures the time between two steps. A step is defined as the local maximum of the Tail velocity during runs. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: IS distance
description: The inter-step (IS) distance measures the distance of the larva's #MT midpoint between two steps. A step is defined as the local maximum of the Tail velocity during runs. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: IS distance (body length)
description: The inter-step (IS) distance measures the distance of the larva's #MT midpoint between two steps. A step is defined as the local maximum of the Tail velocity during runs. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Run speed
description: The speed of the midpoint, measured only during runs. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Run speed (body length)
description: The speed of the midpoint, measured only during runs. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Run speed-modulation
description: The Run speed-modulation indicates whether the run speed is modulated by the animal's orientation with respect to the odour, with positive values indicating that a larva has a higher speed while being oriented towards the odour (absolute bearing angle < 90�) than while being oriented away from the odour (bearing angle > 90�). It calculates as (Run speed towards - Run speed away)/(Run speed towards + Run speed away). Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected). If binning by population was selected, the run speed-modulation based on all valid data points of each bin is displayed.

name: HC angle
description: The HC angle is calculated as the bending angle after minus before a HC. Positive values indicate that the HC was to the left, negative values that it was to the right. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Absolute HC angle
description: The HC angle is calculated as the bending angle after minus before a HC. The absolute HC angle is an estimate for the size of the HC, independent from direction. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: HC reorientation
description: The absolute heading angle before a HC minus the absolute heading angle after the HC. Positive values indicate that the larva is oriented more towards the odour after the HC, negative values that the larva is oriented more away. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: HC rate
description: The number of head casts (HCs) per second. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the number of HCs of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the number of HCs of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected). If binning by population was selected, the number of all HCs within a bin, divided by the duration of the bin is displayed.

name: HC rate-modulation
description: The HC rate-modulation indicates whether the HC rate is modulated by the animal's orientation with respect to the odour, with positive values indicating that a larva has a lower HC rate while being oriented towards the odour (absolute bearing angle < 90�) than while being oriented away from the odour (bearing angle > 90�). It calculates as (HC rate away - HC rate towards)/(HC rate away + HC rate towards). Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the HC rate-modulation of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the HC rate-modulation based on all HCs of each video (if binning by dish was selected). If binning by population was selected, the HC rate-modulation based on all HCs in each bin is displayed.

name: Preference (time)
description: The preference is the time animals spent on the half of the Petri dish that contained the odour minus the time spent on the other half, diveded by the total time. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the preferences of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the preferences of all larvae in each video (if binning by dish was selected). If binning by population was selected, the the number of data points with animals on the half of the Petri dish that contained the odour minus the number of data points on the other half, divided by the total number of data points is displayed.

name: Preference (distance)
description: The average distance of all animals in a given bin from the odour source, transformed to a [-1;1] interval. A value of 1 indicates the animal is directly at the odour source, a value of -1 indicates it is at the maximal distance from the odour source, and a value of 0 indicates it is at the half-maximal distance from the odour source. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Velocity towards odour source
description: The velocity of the larva's midpoint in direction of the odour. Positive values indicate that the animal is moving toward the odour, negative values that the animal is moving away. Displayed is the average value of all data points within a given bin, pooled across all larvae and all trials of an experimental condition.Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the means of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the means of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected), or of all data points in the whole data set (if binning by population was selected) within each bin.

name: Time ratio towards odour source
description: The proportion of time larvae spent oriented towards the odour source, that is, with an absolute bearing angle < 90�. Displayed are mean and 95% CI of the respective proportion of each individual larva (if binning by individual was selected), or of the proportion of all data of each video (if binning by dish was selected). If binning by population was selected, the proportion based on all valid data points of each bin is displayed.
